abstract.displayForm: This manuscript contains the third part of the Hebrew Bible known as Writings (Ketuvim) with numerous marginal glosses in Hebrew and Judeo-Persian. It was copied by Jacob ben Obadiah ben Joseph ben Ezra in the school of Rabbi Mordechai in Kashan in Iran at the request of Rav Samuel ha-Levi. He completed his copy on Tuesday 2 July 1495. The biblical text is vocalised and accompanied by masorah. According to Moses Gaster, this is a unique manuscript showing the vocalisation and accentuation tradition of Ben Naphtali.
